Data.event_text: Indonesian rupiah new format has officially used in Indonesia but many of citizens used old format of rupiah.

The Government of Indonesia officially issued a statement condemning the attack on Istanbul nightclub on New Year's Eve perpetrated by ISIS. The Indonesian Embassy in Istanbul was advised to protect every Indonesian citizens in Turkey and advised Indonesian to stay in contact with local authorities.

MV Zahro Express, a tourist boat carrying 184 people caught fire while en route to Pulau Tidung in Thousands Islands, Jakarta. The incident was caught on video and due to its coincidence with New Year's Day, the incident was covered extensively. At least 23 people were killed in the blaze. Search and Rescue officials stated that 17 people were missing.

links.text: -Wildansyah, Samsudhuha (14 July 2017). "KM Zahro Terbakar Tewaskan 24 Penumpang, KNKT: Api dari Generator". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: A fugitive suspected of carrying out a deadly robbery in Pulomas, East Jakarta in 2016 identified as Ius Pane was arrested by the Indonesian National Police.

links.text: -Rahayu, Yayu Agustini (1 January 2017). "Ius Pane, buronan perampokan Pulomas ditangkap di Medan". Merdeka. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 4 January  Indonesian Government temporarily terminated its military relation with Australia after a suspected insult and discrimination against the symbol and ideology of Indonesia and several sensitive political issues of Indonesia were found during training on a military base in Australia.

links.text: -Santosa, Iwan; Pattisina, Edna (4 January 2017). Galih, Bayu (ed.). "TNI Tunda Kerja Sama Militer dengan ADF Australia". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Bears in Bandung Zoo caught the world's attention after photos taken by tourists shown that the bears have poor welfare and were very skinny.

links.text: -Siswoyo, Harry (2 November 2022). "Beruang Kelaparan di Kebun Binatang Bandung Tuai Kecaman". Viva (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: A photo of a dolphin, who was transported by Sriwijaya Air in a 'really wrong procedure', sparked public debate on the handling of Indonesian animals for commercial and entertainment purposes.

links.text: -Priherdityo, Endro (18 January 2017). "Soal Lumba-lumba di Sriwijaya Air, TIJA Akui Taat Aturan". gaya hidup (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: A 5-month-old baby was found positive of cocaine by the National Narcotics Board in Central Kalimantan.

links.text: -Kholid, Idham (19 January 2017). "BNN Kalteng: Bayi Usia 5 Bulan Positif Narkoba". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: At least 20.000 people joined a march demanding the dismissal and the 'eradication' of the Islamic Defender Front in Bandung, West Java.

links.text: -"'Ribuan orang' di Bandung tuntut pembubaran FPI". BBC News Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 2324 January  The death of 3 students of the Islamic University of Indonesia during an initiation program in Yogyakarta sparked massive outrage and an intense public debate on whether similar program should be continued or discontinued.

links.text: -Yuwono, Markus (24 January 2017). "UII Pastikan 3 Orang Mahasiswa Meninggal Akibat Kegiatan Diksar Mapala". Okezone (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 27 January  One of the judges of the Indonesian Constitutional Court Patrialis Akbar was arrested by the Indonesian Corruption Eradication Commission on a hotel in Jakarta.

links.text: -Gabrillin, Abba (26 January 2017). Asril, Sabrina (ed.). "Patrialis Akbar Ditangkap bersama Seorang Perempuan di Grand Indonesia". KOMPAS (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 2 February  A controversial incident occurred on board Lion Air Flight 745 when 3 crew members asked a female passenger to join them to smoke inside the cockpit. All 3 crew members were "de-activated" from their job. The female passenger reported this event and asked the police to investigate the incident. The incident, however, occurred on 9 January 2017.

links.text: -Koesmawardhani, Nograhany Widhi (3 February 2017). "Diduga Ajak Merokok Penumpang, 3 Kru Lion Air Dinonaktifkan". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 3 February  A boat carrying 40 people sunk near Makassar. At least 21 people survived the accident and 9 people were killed.

links.text: -Abdurrahman, Muhammad Nur (4 February 2017). "Tim SAR Temukan 9 Jenazah Penumpang KM Cahaya Irna". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 9 February  71 houses were either damaged or destroyed when a tornado struck two villages in Banyuasin, South Sumatra. Dozens of people were injured in the incident.

links.text: -"Puting Beliung Luluhlantakkan 71 Bangunan di Banyuasin". JPNN (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 12 people were killed in Kintamani, Bangli Regency, Bali as multiple landslides struck the island.

links.text: -Divianta, Dewi (10 February 2017). "Bali Dikepung Longsor, 12 Warga Kintamani Tewas". liputan6.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 7 schools collapsed after a freak storm struck Manggarai, East Nusa Tenggara. A hall was also destroyed.

links.text: -Bere, Sigiranus Marutho (10 February 2017). Djumena, Erlangga (ed.). "Angin Kencang Terjang Manggarai Timur, Bangunan di 7 Sekolah Ambruk". KOMPAS (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 11 February  A major protest was held by the Indonesian Islamic People Forum in response to Jakarta's Christian Governor Basuki Tjahaja Purnama's remarks on Al-Maidah ayah 51 in October 2016. The protest was one of several major protests opposing the governor that was held by Islamic hardliner organizations in the country.
12 February  Tensions rise as an Indonesian army post was destroyed by locals in Sukabumi.

links.text: -Topan, Wildan (12 February 2017). "Kalap, Warga Rusak Pos TNI AU di Sukabumi". Okezone (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Telkom 3S, an Indonesian satellite owned by Indonesian-communication giants Telkomsel, lifted off from Kourou, French Guiana.

links.text: -Noor II, Achmad Rouzni (15 February 2017). "Alhamdulillah, Satelit Telkom 3S Sukses Menjelajah Angkasa". detikinet (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: An image depicting the killing of an orangutan and its subsequent eating by local people in Central Kalimantan shocked the nation. The Indonesian House of Representatives ordered an immediate investigation into the killing. Reports suggested that the perpetrators were workers of a nearby palm oil factory.

links.text: -Retaduari, Elza Astari (14 February 2017). "Orangutan Dibunuh dan Dimasak, Komisi IV Minta Polisi Usut Tuntas". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 15 February  The 2017 Indonesian local election. President Joko Widodo designated this day as a national holiday.

links.text: -Prasetia, Andhika (10 February 2017). "Pilkada Serentak, 15 Februari Ditetapkan Jadi Hari Libur Nasional". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 16 February
1 March  King Salman of Saudi Arabia arrived at Halim Perdana Kusuma Airport and officially began the royal family first foreign trip to Indonesia in 35 years

links.text: -Rachman, Anita (1 March 2017). "Saudi King Kicks Off 12-Day Indonesia Trip". Wall Street Journal. ISSN 0099-9660. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-
-Rachman, Anita (1 March 2017). "Saudi King Kicks Off 12-Day Indonesia Trip". Wall Street Journal. ISSN 0099-9660. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 2 March  Riot occurred inside a prison in Jambi. Widespread damage was reported at the prison. At least 6 prisoners were taken to hospital and 4 others escaped from the facility.

links.text: -Lukman, Agus (2 March 2017). "Rusuh di Lapas Jambi, Empat Napi Kabur - kbr.id". Kantor Berita Radio (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: King Salman officially ended its diplomatic trip in Bogor and Jakarta and began his vacation trip in Bali.

links.text: -Erviani, Ni Komang (4 March 2017). "Bali welcomes King Salman". The Jakarta Post. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: The first ever Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA) Leaders' Summit was held in Indonesia's capital city of Jakarta.

links.text: -Panda, Ankit (8 March 2017). "Indian Ocean Rim Association Concludes First-Ever Leaders' Summit". The Diplomat. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 6 March  Hundreds of homes were destroyed after a massive landslipe swept through a village in West Sumatra. 6 people, including one infant, were killed in the disaster.

links.text: -Fadhil, Haris (6 March 2017). "Korban Meninggal Longsor Sumbar Jadi 6 Orang, 1 di Antaranya Bayi". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Reports of widespread damage after a freak storm swept Surabaya. Indonesian National Police also confirmed the presence of hail during the storm. At least 1 person was killed due to the incident.

links.text: -Anjungroso, Fajar, ed. (8 March 2017). "Titik Pohon Tumbang akibat Hujan Es dan Putih Beliung di Surbaya". TribunNews. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: A Grab ojek driver in Bandung was rammed by a local bus driver, which caused him to be in critical condition. The suspect was arrested and was charged for attempted murder.

links.text: -Putera, Andri Donnal (8 March 2017). Aditama, Yudhi Maulana (ed.). "Driver-nya Ditabrak Sopir Angkot, Grab Lapor Polisi". TribunNews Bogor (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 9 March  A video of a family frantically screaming inside a car after being attacked by mobs of local drivers, who refused the operation of online transportation in Indonesia, went viral on social media. The attack drew widespread condemnation and subsequently caused public outcry on whether local buses (angkot) should be operated anymore on the streets.

links.text: -Ndoen, Ferry, ed. (9 March 2017). "Aksi Brutal Sopir Keluarga Korban Perusakan Mobil Trauma". Pos kupang (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 10 March  Thousands of people joined the anti-online transportation protest throughout Indonesia. The protest was attended mainly by local bus drivers and ojek drivers who refused to accept the operation of online transportation in Indonesia.

links.text: -Rachman, Dede Arip (10 March 2017). "FOTO: Ratusan Sopir Angkot di Bandung Demo Tolak Angkutan Online". photo.sindonews.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 12 March  Arema FC won the 2017 President Cup.

links.text: -Hanoatubun, Nicklas (12 March 2017). "Arema FC Juara Piala Presiden 2017". bola.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 13 March  A college student was shot dead by a policeman in Jember due to 'revenge'. Police later detained the suspect and fired him. The incident sparked massive outcry in police brutality.

links.text: -Bramastra, Aji (13 March 2017). "Tragis, Mahasiswa Jember Tewas Ditembak Anggota Brimob, Ternyata Karena Masalah Sepele". Tribun Jatim. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: A sling of a lift suddenly snapped in M Square Department Store in Jakarta. Due to the incident, 25 people were injured. Police suspected that the lift had been overloaded.

links.text: -Manalu, Juli Etha Ramaida (17 March 2017). "Lift Jatuh di Blok M Square : Korban 25 Orang, Umumnya Patah Tulang". Bisnis.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Public outrage after 58-year-old Indra hanged himself during Facebook Live.

links.text: -Aminah, Andi Nur (18 March 2017). "Heboh, Pria Ini Bunuh Diri Secara Live di Facebook". Republika Online (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 20 March  Police rescued a Malaysian woman identified as Ling Ling in Batam. She had been kidnapped by several people for at least a month after being abducted by several people from her house in Johor, Malaysia.

links.text: -Dharmastuti, Hestiana (20 March 2017). "Penculikan WN Malaysia Ling Ling di Batam dan 'Kado' Pembebasan". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 22 March  Indonesian embassies had been informed about the attack on Westminster and condemned the attack. The Foreign Ministry later sent condolences to the victims of the attack.
24 March  Gunfire erupted in Cilegon after police raided a house linked to a terror plot. 1 person was killed in the incident.

links.text: -Djumena, Erlangga, ed. (23 March 2017). "Polisi Geledah Rumah Terduga Teroris yang Tewas di Cilegon". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Another massive protest conducted by Islamic religious group was held in Istiqlal Mosque, Jakarta.

A first year student of a renowned school Taruna Nusantara, was found dead in his bed in a barrack with a deep wound on his neck. Police later arrested the suspect who was his own barrack-mate. The murder drew public condemnation and outcry on Indonesian's school security.

links.text: -Al Faqir, Anisyah (31 March 2017). "Siswa SMA Taruna Nusantara tewas di barak diduga dibunuh rekannya". merdeka.com. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 1 April  A massive landslide swept through a village in Ponorogo. Dozens of people were missing in the initial aftermath and hundreds more were evacuated. Hundreds of homes were also destroyed. Disaster area was later declared and search and rescue operation was commenced in the area. 10 people were injured.

links.text: -Al Alawi, Muhlis (1 April 2017). Djumena, Erlangga (ed.). "Longsor Ponorogo, 38 Orang Diperkirakan Masih Tertimbun". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 2 April  At least 4 people were killed and dozens more injured after a minibus carrying tourists slammed into a mango tree in Gunung Kidul, Yogyakarta.

links.text: -Hidayati, Nurul (2 April 2017). Akbar, Jihad (ed.). "Korban Tewas Kecelakaan Mobil Wisatawan di Gunungkidul Jadi 4 Orang". kumparan (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 3 April  Indonesian Ministry of Foreign Affairs condemned the bombing in Saint Petersburg Metro which killed 15 people and injured more than 60 others.
7 April  Indonesian Ministry of Foreign Affairs condemned another terror attack in Sweden's capital Stockholm and issued a warning for Indonesians living in Stockholm.
8 April  6 suspected terrorists were involved in a gunfight with the police after attacking a police station in Tuban, all were later shot dead by police.

links.text: -Nugroho, Sapto, ed. (9 April 2017). "Baku Tembak dengan Polisi, 6 Terduga Teroris di Tuban Ini Tewas, 1 Ditangkap Hidup-hidup". TribunNews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 5 people went missing after a landslide struck a village in Nganjuk, East Java.

links.text: -Swasty, Renatha (9 April 2017). "BNPB: Longsor di Nganjuk 5 Orang Hilang". medcom.id (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Indonesia showed its solidarity to the Egyptians in response to the attacks on two Coptic churches in Alexandria and Tanta on Palm Sunday, which killed 45 people and wounded hundreds.

10 April  Massive public outcry and condemnation after 5 members of a family was killed "sadistically" by an unknown person. The only survivor of the murder was a 4-year-old Kirana who suffered serious injury in the aftermath of the murder. The case became sensational and an arrest warrant was later issued after the perpetrator was identified as Andi Lala.

links.text: -Leandha, Mei (12 April 2017). Damanik, Caroline (ed.). "Pembunuhan Satu Keluarga di Medan dan Rasa Aman yang Mahal Halaman all". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 1012 April  Joko Widodo stated his intention on moving Indonesia's capital from Jakarta to Palangkaraya, Central Kalimantan due to economic and strategic benefit. This was the first serious discussion about the moving of the capital to Palangkaraya since 2013.

links.text: -Andwika, Rizky (7 April 2017). "Jokowi minta Bappenas kaji pemindahan ibu kota ke Palangkaraya". merdeka.com. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Prominent figure of the Indonesian Corruption Eradication Commission, Novel Baswedan, was splashed with highly corrosive liquid by unknown perpetrators. The incident drew widespread condemnation. He was later flown to Singapore for further treatment.

links.text: -Karensa, Edo (11 April 2017). "KPK Investigator Novel Suffers Burns to His Face After Acid Attack by Unknown Men". Jakarta Globe. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Banyumas Police Station was attacked by a man wielding a knife, injuring 3 people. The attacker was shot dead by police. Investigation found that he had pledged allegiance to ISIS before the attack.

links.text: -Hidayati, Nurul (11 April 2017). Muslimah, Salmah (ed.). "Polres Banyumas Diserang Pria Bercadar". kumparan (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: At least 2.400 people were evacuated after massive flash flood swept through Southeast Aceh Regency. 2 people were killed and more than 100 houses were damaged.

links.text: -Triyoga, Hardani (12 April 2017). "Banjir Bandang Terjang Aceh Tenggara, Ratusan Rumah Rusak". VIVA (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 12 April  12 miners drowned to their deaths in Gresik, East Java after their boat capsized.

links.text: -Wahyudiyanta, Imam (13 April 2017). "Perahu Tambang di Gresik Terbalik, 12 Penumpang Tenggelam". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 18 April  A driver rammed police during a traffic check in Palembang. The driver was going to escape the check when the incident occurred. Police fired several shots at the car, which later killed the driver's mother who was sitting at the back seat. The driver and the other passengers were injured. The incident sparked public debate, and opinions on the public were divided, where several people blamed the driver and several other blamed the police. The incident raised questions on police procedures on handling suspects.

links.text: -"Polisi Tembaki Mobil Kabur dari Razia Ala Koboi, Tewaskan Satu Perempuan dan Lukai Balita". Vice (in Indonesian). 19 April 2017. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 19 April  2017 Jakarta gubernatorial election, second round has been decided and confirmed with the next incumbent of Jakarta government is given to Anies Baswedan and Sandiaga Uno as vice government will taking office at October 2017.
20 April  Indonesia and America officially declared a joint effort to combat terrorism.

links.text: -Waluyo, Andylala (20 April 2017). "AS – Indonesia Sepakati Kerjasama Kontra Teroris untuk Perdamaian Dunia Khususnya Asia Tenggara". VOA Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 22 April  Achintya Holte Nielsen won the Miss Indonesia 2017 competition.

links.text: -S, Deddy (23 April 2017). "Achintya Holte dari NTB Terpilih Sebagai Miss Indonesia 2017". gaya hidup (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 23 April  A bus carrying tourists rammed through 13 vehicles in Puncak, Bogor, killing 4 people and injuring 21people.

links.text: -Bempah, Radeva Pragia (23 April 2017). "Korban tewas bus tabrak 12 kendaraan di Puncak jadi 4 orang". merdeka.com. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 11 hikers were struck by lightning in Dieng Plateau, Wonosobo. At least 3 of them died. The location of the hike was later closed by authorities.

links.text: -Maharani, Shinta (24 April 2017). Widisatuti, Rina (ed.). "3 Pendaki Gunung Prau Tewas Terkena Petir, Kawasan Dieng Ditutup". Tempo. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: At least 52 houses were damaged or destroyed after a magnitude 5.4 earthquake struck Tasikmalaya, West Java.

links.text: -Rahadian, Deden (24 April 2017). "52 Rumah di Tasikmalaya Rusak Akibat Gempa 5,4 SR". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 26 April  A police in Bengkulu fatally shot his own son after thinking he was a burglar. Outrage followed and sparking further debate on police procedure. Questions surfaced on whether police should own a gun.

links.text: -Julikawati, Phesi Ester (26 April 2017). "Dikira Maling, Polisi Tembak Mati Anaknya Sendiri". Tempo. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 2830 April  1.000 flower arrangements were sent to the Jakarta City Hall for Basuki Tjahaja Purnama in response to his loss during the Jakarta gubernatorial election, the first time in the history of Indonesian politic where such phenomenon occurred. The phenomenon went viral and was awarded by the Indonesian Museum of Records as the largest flower arrangements ever occurred in Indonesia.

links.text: -Laksana, Bisma Alief (28 April 2017). "Hingga Hari Ini, Balai Kota Dibanjiri 4.000 Karangan Bunga untuk Ahok". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 30 April
1 May  Several demonstrators of the International Labour Day set fire to several floral arrangement dedicated for Basuki Tjahaja Purnama, prompting criticism.

links.text: -Dony, Bartanius (1 May 2017). "Aksi Hari Buruh, Karangan Bunga Ahok di Balai Kota Dibakar". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 5 May  Islamist hardliner group held another mass rally, demanding the imprisonment of the incumbent Christian Governor of Jakarta Basuki Tjahaja Purnama.
At least 200 prisoners escaped from Sialang Bungkuk Prison in Pekanbaru, Riau. Several dozens were immediately captured by the Indonesian National Police while others were still on the run.

links.text: -Sawitri, Angelina Anjar (5 May 2017). Hidayat, Dody (ed.). "200 Tahanan Kabur dari Rutan Sialang Bungkuk Pekanbaru". Tempo. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian Islamist Organisation, Hizbut Tahrir Indonesia (HTI) suspected of supporting the ideology of caliphate was "dissolved" by the Indonesian Government. The group was accused by Indonesians of supporting the change of Indonesian ideology from Pancasila to khilafah ideology. Multiple Islamic Organisation supported the Government.

links.text: -"Hizbut Tahrir Indonesia dibubarkan pemerintah". BBC News Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Djarot Saiful Hidayat was inaugurated as the acting governor of Jakarta after the incumbent Governor of Jakarta, Basuki Tjahaja Purnama a.k.a. Ahok, was convicted guilty for blasphemy.

links.text: -"Djarot akan gantikan Ahok sebagai Gubernur DKI Jakarta". BBC News Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Mass rally, organised by Ahok's supporter, was held immediately after the verdict

Hundreds of mass candles act, attended by thousands, were held across Indonesia, with numerous people sang Indonesian national song and demanded the release of Ahok. The hashtag #RIPHukum (eng #RIPLaw) immediately went viral after Ahok's verdict.
12 May  7 people were killed after a landslide swept houses in East Luwu, South Sulawesi.

links.text: -Abdurrahman, Muhammad Nur (12 May 2017). "Longsor di Luwu Timur Sulsel, 7 Orang Tewas". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 17 May  4 Indonesian soldiers were killed after a freak cannon accident during military training in Natuna, Riau Islands.

links.text: -Oktara, Diko (17 May 2017). Widisatuti, Rina (ed.). "4 Prajurit TNI Tewas dan 8 Terluka Saat Latihan Tempur di Natuna". Tempo. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 18 May  A student was killed after reportedly beaten to death by his senior in a police academy in Semarang. The seniors stated that they were "just teaching a lesson". The incident sparked massive public outcry, with Indonesian people questioned about the safety of public education places.

links.text: -Idhom, Addi Mawahibun (18 May 2017). "Taruna Akpol Semarang Tewas Setelah Dianiaya 12 Senior". tirto.id (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 19 May  5 people were killed after KM Mutiara, a ship carrying 134 passengers and 50 trucks, caught fire off Masalembu, East Java.

links.text: -Gumiwang, Ringkang (20 May 2017). "KM Mutiara Sentosa Terbakar, 187 Penumpang Berhasil Dievakuasi". Bisnis.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 22 May  Indonesian Foreign Ministry advised Indonesians in Manchester to be cautious after a terror attack inside Manchester Arena, killing 22 people. The ministry later condemned the bombing.

links.text: -Hardoko, Ervan, ed. (23 May 2017). "KBRI London Imbau WNI Jauhi Kawasan Manchester Arena Halaman all". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 1 June  Indonesian Rupiah 2017 banknotes new format has been officially used in all regions of Indonesia.
5 June  Concerns emerge among Indonesian officials after the start of the diplomatic crisis in Qatar.
7 June  The Ministry of Foreign Affairs issued a statement condemning the terror attack in London Bridge and Borough Street which left 7 people dead and 48 people injured.
11 June  A fatal shoot and run robbery in Daan Mogot, Jakarta sparked public debate on street safety.

links.text: -Marhaenjati, Bayu (15 June 2017). "Pelaku Dibekuk, Polisi Ungkap Kronologi Perampokan di SPBU Daan Mogot". BeritaSatu (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 3 people were killed and 19 were injured after a bus fell into a ravine in Merak Highway.

links.text: -Iqbal, Muhammad (12 June 2017). Hidayati, Nurul (ed.). "Bus Terjun dari Jembatan di Tol Tangerang-Merak, 3 Penumpang Tewas". Kumparan (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 100 houses were damaged after a massive hailstorm in Karo, North Sumatra.

links.text: -Siregar, Wahyudi Aulia (13 June 2017). "Kabupaten Karo Dilanda Hujan Es, 100 Rumah Warga Rusak : Okezone News". Okezone (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 13 June  Indonesian college student Italia Chandra Kirana Putri was shot dead by a burglar after she tried to tackle the burglar from stealing her motorcycle. The incident caused mass outrage.

links.text: -Zuliansyah, Rangga Agung (13 June 2017). "Penembakan Italia Mengikis Rasa Aman Publik". Tangerang News. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: The decision of Indonesian Education and Culture Minister Muhadjir to implement "full day school" was criticized by the public.

The Ministry of Education and Culture reviewed the Full Day School program. Minister of Education and Culture Muhadjir Effendy later announced that Full Day School program won't be cancelled despite numerous criticisms from the public.
16 June  Former Indonesian Health Minister Siti Fadilah Supari was sentenced to 4 years in prison due to her involvement in a corruption case.

links.text: -Gabrillin, Abba (16 June 2017). Gatra, Sandro (ed.). "Mantan Menkes Siti Fadilah Divonis 4 Tahun Penjara". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 8 people were killed after their car slammed into a truck in Bali.

links.text: -Syarief, Ika Suryani (18 June 2017). "Travel Alami Kecelakaan di Jembrana, 8 Pemudik Asal Jember Meninggal Dunia". Suara Surabaya (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: An Indonesian soldier was stabbed by a suspected gang member in Kemayoran, Jakarta. Hours later, a revenge attack occurred. A car crashed into the gang members, killing two. The driver was later arrested.

links.text: -Salim, Hanz Jimenez (18 June 2017). "Anggota TNI Ditusuk Orang Tak Dikenal di Kemayoran". liputan6.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 23 June  44th American President Barack Obama and his family visited Indonesia and stayed for vacation. His visit was welcomed warmly by the public and the media.

links.text: -Irmasari, Dewi (23 June 2017). "Obama Akan 'Mudik' ke Indonesia Hari Ini, Langsung ke Bali". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 24 June  4 people were killed after Rosalia Indah Bus fell into a ravine in Purbalingga, Central Java.

links.text: -Ridlo, Muhamad (24 June 2017). "Kecelakaan Bus di Purbalingga, 4 Orang Tewas". liputan6.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 25 June  Two people snuck into a police station in North Sumatra and stabbed an officer to death. Witnesses reported that the attackers shouted "Allahu Akbar" (God is great) during the attack. One of the attacker was later shot dead by the police while the other was arrested. The attack drew widespread condemnation among Indonesians. Numerous religious group condemned the attack.

links.text: -Safitri, Inge Klara (30 June 2017). Widisatuti, Rina (ed.). "Polisi Korban Teror di Polda Sumut Ditusuk di Sekujur Tubuhnya". Tempo. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 26 June  7-Eleven closed all their operational franchises in Indonesia.

links.text: -Fauzi, Achmad (24 June 2017). Jatmiko, Bambang Priyo (ed.). "Hampir Seluruh Gerai 7-Eleven di Jakarta Telah Tutup sebelum 30 Juni". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 26  28 June  At least 33 hot air balloons were sighted and reported by airline pilots throughout Indonesia. The incident caused disturbance in air travel and sparked outrage and national debate on whether hot air balloon should be flown in Java.

links.text: -Prasetia, Andhika (26 June 2017). "Balon Udara Membahayakan Berhamburan di Jateng, NOTAM Dikeluarkan". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 30 June  A man stabbed two policemen inside a mosque in South Jakarta. The policemen were injured. Witnesses stated that the attacker shouted "Taghut" during the attack. The attacker was followed by the police and later was shot dead on the street. The attack drew widespread condemnation among Indonesians. Police stated that the attacker was a "hardliner Muslim".

links.text: -Subagja, Indra; Pradana, Aria (30 June 2017). "2 Polisi Ditusuk Pria Usai Salat Isya di Masjid Dekat Mabes Polri". kumparan (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: A phreatic eruption occurred in Sileri Crater. injuring at least 10 people.

links.text: -Rastika, Icha, ed. (2 July 2017). "Kawah Sileri Dieng Semburkan Lumpur 200 Meter, 10 Orang Luka-luka". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: A BASARNAS-owned helicopter crashed onto a mountain in Temanggung, Central Java while responding to the aftermath of the eruption. All 8 people on board were killed in the crash.

links.text: -Linawati, Mevi; Haryanto, Andry; Wahyu, Felek; Nugroho, Fajar Eko; Muhammad, Djibril; Rozie, Fachrur (4 July 2017). "Misi Kemanusiaan Berujung Petaka". liputan6.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 4 July  An ISIS flag was found outside the Kebayoran Lama police station.

links.text: -Pratama, Akhdi Martin (4 July 2017). Ali, Fidel (ed.). "Mapolsek Kebayoran Lama Dipasang Bendera ISIS oleh Orang Tidak Dikenal". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Muhammad Hidayat reported Kaesang Pangarep, the son of incumbent Indonesian President Joko Widodo, to the police. Hidayat suspected Kaesang of blasphemy since he claimed that he found blasphemous material in one of Kaesang's video. The incident caused massive media attention and public outrage on Hidayat since most of the public believed that not a single blasphemous material were found inside the video.

links.text: -Rahadian, Taufik; Riso, Nadia (5 July 2017). Habibi, Ikhwanul (ed.). "Muhammad Hidayat, Pelapor Kaesang Berstatus Tersangka Hate Speech". kumparan (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Joice Warouw slapped an Aviation Security official in Sam Ratulangi International Airport, Manado. The incident was caught on video and the video subsequently went viral. Joice slapped the official because she refused to take off her watch and put it into the airport's X-Ray machine because she was the wife of a commando. The incident caused subsequent outrage.

links.text: -Adianto, Gautama (5 July 2017). "Istri Pejabat Tampar Petugas Bandara karena Diminta Lakukan Ini". liputan6.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: A marriage of a 16-year-old Slamet and 71-year-old Rohaya in South Sumatra shocked the public. The news of the marriage went viral. Later, Social Minister Khofifah Indar Parawansa stated that their marriage was illegal.

links.text: -Utama, Lazuardhi (5 July 2017). "Mensos Sesalkan Pernikahan Remaja dengan Nenek 71 Tahun". Viva (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 6 July  A tornado struck Deli Serdang, North Sumatra. 93 houses were either damaged or destroyed.

links.text: -Muhardiansyah, Yan (6 July 2017). "Puting beliung terjang Deli Serdang, puluhan rumah rusak". merdeka.com. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 8 July  A suspected pressure cooker bomb exploded inside a house in Buah Batu, Bandung, West Java. The maker of the bomb, Agus Wiguna, was injured in the accidental explosion and was later arrested by the police. In the following hours, police found another bomb from the same house and foiled two terror plots targeting a church and a café in the area.

links.text: -Santoso, Audrey (8 July 2017). "Bom Panci Meledak Saat Perakit Berjualan Bakso Goreng". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-
-Dewati, Pranamya (8 July 2017). Habibi, Ikhwanul (ed.). "Bom Panci yang Meledak di Bandung Dibuat untuk Teror Kafe dan Gereja". kumparan (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 9 July  An IT expert, Hermansyah, was beaten while he was driving with his wife in Jagorawi toll. Police stated that he was in serious condition due to the beating. In the initial hours, conspiracy theory began to surface, with thousands of people blamed the police of conducting an inside job.

links.text: -Nailufar, Nibras Nada (9 July 2017). Syatiri, Ana Shofiana (ed.). "Diserang di Jagorawi, Hermansyah Ahli Telematika Terluka di Kepala, Leher, dan Tangan". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-
-Hamdi, Imam; Ferdinanto, Riky (11 July 2017). Susanto, Elik (ed.). "Empat Berita Hoax Seputar Pembacokan Hermansyah". Tempo. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 11 July  Police arrested the suspects of the hacking of Hermansyah. Road rage was revealed as the cause of the incident.

links.text: -Nailufar, Nibras Nada (9 July 2017). Syatiri, Ana Shofiana (ed.). "Bachtiar Nasir Sebut Hermansyah Diserang karena Senggolan dengan Mobil Lain Halaman all". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 13 July  President Joko Widodo signed a decree to ban and dissolute hardline Islamist groups in Indonesia. The move was made since the authorities found an Islamist group that would like to implement sharia and a caliphate in Indonesia, which conflicted with the nation's secular ideology. Though the move was received positively by most Indonesians and most Islamic groups; civil rights group, opposition group and conservative Islamic group condemned the move; calling them as a move of dictatorship.

links.text: -Rahmah, Ghoida (19 July 2017). Susanto, Elik (ed.). "HTI Resmi Dibubarkan, Kemenkumham Cabut Status Hukumnya". Tempo. Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 40 houses were damaged after a magnitude 5.5 earthquake struck Padangsidempuan, North Sumatra.

links.text: -Siswoyo, Harry (14 July 2017). "Gempa Darat Dangkal Guncang Padang Sidempuan". VIVA (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Social media application Telegram was blocked by the Indonesian Government. The government blocked the app due to fear of terrorists using the app. This move however was shamed by the Indonesian public, stating that the move was ineffective and unnecessary.

links.text: -"Dinilai bahayakan keamanan negara, Telegram resmi diblokir di Indonesia". BBC News Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Bus and truck collision in Probolinggo kills 10 people

links.text: -Budiasto, Bakti Buwono, ed. (14 July 2017). "Kecelakaan Maut, Truk Tabrak Bus di Pantura Probolinggo, 10 Orang Tewas". Tribunjateng.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 16 July  Video footage captured an autistic boy being bullied at Gunadarma University, Jakarta. The video went viral and it immediately sparked massive public outrage, with the public demanded justice for the victim. Gunadarma University official later announced an investigation into the case.

links.text: -Indrawan, Aditya Fajar (16 July 2017). "Kampus Gunadarma Usut Bully pada Mahasiswa Berkebutuhan Khusus". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 24 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: A video captured a bullying of a Junior High School Student in Thamrin City, Jakarta. The victim was bullied by 9 other students. The video showed that the victim was kicked and punched by the perpetrators. The video immediately went viral, sparking massive outrage and criticism. Due to the recent incident of bullying, both cases become a national debate, with questions raised on school's safety.

links.text: -Akhmad, Harits Tryan (17 July 2017). "Sadis! Siswi SMP Di-Bully di Thamrin City". Okezone (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Australia agreed to provide funding for 10 'new Bali'.

links.text: -Hawley, Samantha (17 July 2017). "Australia to provide funding to help Indonesia create 10 new Balis". ABC News. Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Gunadarma University confirmed that the boy that was being bullied the day prior was not an autistic boy.

links.text: -Anugrahadi, Ady (18 July 2017). "Gunadarma: MF Korban Bullying Tidak Menderita Autis". liputan6.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 18 July  At least 47 houses and 2 mosques were damaged after an earthquake measuring 3.7 on the Richter Scale struck Bandung Regency.

links.text: -"Gempa 3,7 SR Guncang Kabupaten Bandung". SINDOnews.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: A villager was killed and several others were injured after a military bomb accidentally set off in a house in Riau. The bomb was accidentally left unattended by the military after training in the area.

links.text: -Hindarto, Yugo (20 July 2017). "Bom TNI AU Meledak di Riau, Satu Orang Meninggal". CNN Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 22 July  Portions of a pillar collapsed during a graduation ceremony in Bandung Institute of Technology (ITB), Bandung. 6 people were injured in the incident.

links.text: -Dinillah, Mukhlis (22 July 2017). "6 Orang Jadi Korban Batu Pilar ITB Runtuh, Ada yang Terluka di Kepala". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 23 July  A massive explosion rocked the city of Kebumen. The explosion occurred on a house in a dense residential area. Though dozens of structures were either damaged or destroyed, no one was killed or injured in the incident. Police stated that firecrackers inside the house might have been ignited.

links.text: -Imanulhaq, Abdul, ed. (23 July 2017). "Ledakan Misterius Hancurkan Rumah di Kebumen". Tribunjateng.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 26 July  Yulianis, witness of the corruption case of Anas Urbaningrum, testified on the People's Representative Council on how Corruption Eradication Commission treated her during the case.

links.text: -Waskita, Ferdinand (25 July 2017). Agustina, Dewi (ed.). "Yulianis Soroti Lemahnya Supervisi KPK". Tribunnews.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 28 July  Thousands of hardliner Islamist and Hizbut Tahrir Indonesia (HTI) members held a rally in Jakarta to oppose President Joko Widodo's decision to ban hardliner Muslims organisation.

links.text: -Waluyo, Andylala (29 July 2017). "Aksi 287 Iringi 'Judicial Review' Tolak Perppu Ormas ke MK". VOA Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 2 August - Leader of the opposition party, Indonesian Unity Party, Hary Tanoesoedibjo, declared his intention to support incumbent President Joko Widodo as a candidate of the 2019 Indonesian presidential election.

links.text: -Sutrisno, Elvan Dany (2 August 2017). "Bikin Kaget, Hary Tanoe Bakal Dukung Jokowi Capres 2019". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Outcry after a pitbull fatally attacked a young child in Malang.

links.text: -Sudiono, Aries (7 August 2017). "Bocah Tewas Digigit Anjing Pitbull di Malang". BeritaSatu (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Series of attacks by monkeys in Boyolali, Central Java sparked fears among residents.

links.text: -Wismabrata, Michael Hangga (7 August 2017). Damanik, Caroline (ed.). "Timeline Berita Terbaru Kontributor Surakarta, Michael Hangga Wismabrata". KOMPAS (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 8 August - A burglar was beaten by a mob in Bekasi. The mob later set him on fire while he was in a critical condition. The incident was caught on tape and sparked a wide outrage throughout Indonesia. Public outcry regarding the mob justice immediately followed.

links.text: -Durohman, Ibad; Rizal, Muhammad; Nugroho, Irwan (10 August 2017). "Pamit Cium Tangan, Pulang Mati Dibakar". detikx. Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 11 August - 5 people were killed and 4 others were injured after a propane tanker exploded in a harbour in Serang.

links.text: -Hidayat, Mohammad Arief; Deslatama, Yandi (11 August 2017). "Ledakan Maut Galangan Kapal di Serang gara-gara Tabung Gas". VIVA (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 15 August - Indonesian National Police arrested 5 people in Antapani, Bandung. Police suspected that they were planning to execute a chemical attack.

links.text: -Marsiela, Adi; Arnaz, Farouk (15 August 2017). "Polisi Tangkap Lima Terduga Teroris di Bandung". BeritaSatu (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 16 August - After months of delay and uncertainty, the Indonesian Aerospace N-219 flew for the first time.

links.text: -Haryanti, Rosiana (16 August 2019). Wedhaswary, Inggried Dwi (ed.). "Hari Ini 2 Tahun Lalu, Pesawat N219 "Nurtanio" Uji Coba Terbang Perdana". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 18 August - Indonesian President Joko Widodo officially opened the Asian Games Countdown in Jakarta and Palembang.

links.text: -Haq, Muhammad Fida Ul (18 August 2017). "Jokowi, JK dan Djarot Hadiri Countdown Asian Games di Monas". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 20 August - The Malaysian Government issued an official apology after an incident in which the Indonesian flag was accidentally shown upside down. The incident sparked massive outrage and further straining the diplomatic ties of the Indonesian and the Malaysian government.

links.text: -Vinanda, Rufki Ade (20 August 2017). "Bendera Indonesia Terbalik di SEA Games, Ini Permintaan Maaf Malaysia". Okezone (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 2029 August - A major Umrah company, First Travel, was accused of fraud after hundreds of its customers were neglected.

links.text: -"Dana umrah: Bos First Travel didakwa penggelapan dan pencucian uang". BBC News Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 25 August - Indonesian Police revealed a major hate-speech website which was responsible for spreading false information and hoax.

links.text: -Lestari, Sri (25 August 2017). "Polisi diminta usut penyandang dana kelompok Saracen". BBC News Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 3 September - 5 people died after a minibus went out of control on Cipali Highway, West Java.

links.text: -Fahmi, Yusron (3 September 2017). "Kecelakaan Maut di Tol Cipali, 5 Orang Tewas". liputan6.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 7 September - The Indonesian Ministry of Foreign Affairs confirmed that no Indonesians were killed or injured after a massive 8.1 magnitude earthquake struck the state of Chiapas, Mexico, which killed at least 100 people. The Indonesian government later sent their deepest sympathy to Mexico.
8 September - A fire on board a Pertamina ship killed at least 5 workers. One person was critically injured.

links.text: -Hartini, Desy (8 September 2017). "5 Pekerja Tewas saat Perbaiki Kapal Milik Pertamina". KOMPAS.tv (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 9 September - A case in which a baby named Debora was denied treatment due to lack of futds sparked outrage.

links.text: -Toriq, Ahmad (9 September 2017). "Cerita Pilu di Jakarta: Bayi Debora Meninggal karena Tak Ada Biaya". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 1424 September - 3 teenagers died and 76 were taken to hospital due to drug consumption in Southeast Sulawesi. The authorities stated that it was a new kind of drug, identified as Paracetamol Caffein Carisoprodol.

links.text: -Chadijah, Rina (14 September 2017). "Tiga Tewas, 60 Dirawat Akibat Konsumsi PCC di Kendari". Benar News (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-
-"Empat hal tentang PPC, obat keras yang 'menggemparkan' Kendari". BBC News Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 15 September - 138 structures were damaged or destroyed in South Solok, West Sumatra after a massive flash flood swept the area. South Solok Regency later declared a state of emergency.

links.text: -Rizqo, Kanavino Ahmad (15 September 2017). "Banjir Bandang di Solok Selatan Sumbar, 138 Rumah Rusak". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Indonesians who lives in the British Virgin Islands were evacuated by the government after major Hurricane Irma swept the area and causing mass devastation.

links.text: -Nadlir, Mohammad (16 September 2017). Hardoko, Ervan (ed.). "Akibat Badai Irma, Kemenlu RI Evakuasi 7 WNI di British Virgin Island". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Prominent Indonesian figures Prabowo Subianto and Amien Rais took part in a "solidarity for Rohingya" act at the National Monument, Jakarta. The march, however, was accused of being filled with hate speech.

links.text: -Hariyanto, Ibnu (16 September 2017). "Prabowo dan Amien Rais Ikut Aksi Bela Rohingya". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 19 September - Indonesian Foreign Minister Retno Marsudi has appealed for calm after a 7.1 M.w earthquake struck Mexico City, the capital of Mexico, which killed 369 people. The government of Indonesia confirmed that there were no Indonesians killed in the disaster and later sent their deepest condolences to the victims of the disaster.
28 September  Indonesian Government official said that 120,000 people have been evacuated from their homes on Bali, following warnings that Mount Agung will erupt.

links.text: -"Indonesian official: More than 120,000 flee Bali volcano". Fox News. 28 September 2017.-

Data.event_text: 29 September - 7 people in Malang, East Java were killed due to carbon monoxide poisoning. Authorities believed that the generator was, somehow, placed inside the room and stated that most of the victims were not aware of the amount of carbon monoxide inside the room.

links.text: -Hidayat, Mohammad Arief; Aditya, Lucky (29 September 2017). "Tujuh Orang Tewas Keracunan Karbon Monoksida Genset". VIVA (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 1 October - The Indonesian Government announced that no Indonesians were injured or killed in the mass shooting in Las Vegas, which killed 58 people. Indonesian President condemned the shooting in its strongest term and called the incident as a "despicable terror attack".
9 October - A gay spa in Jakarta was stormed by the Indonesian National Police. 51 people were arrested for "doing inappropriate sexual behavior".

11 October - A magnitude 4.9 earthquake struck the city of Lembata, East Nusa Tenggara. 10 aftershocks were recorded. At least 100 structures across the city were damaged or destroyed and more than 2.000 were displaced.

links.text: -Fajar, Taufik (11 October 2017). "Astaga! Gempa 4,9 SR Guncang Lembata NTT". Okezone (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 14 October - President Joko Widodo officially opened several newly built highways.

links.text: -Pradana, Rio Sandy (13 October 2017). "Presiden Jokowi Resmikan Jalan Tol Medan-Tebing Tinggi". Bisnis.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 16 October -Anies Baswedan and Sandiaga Uno were officially inaugurated and ratified as governors and representative in Jakarta.

links.text: -Kuwado, Fabian Januarius (16 October 2017). Galih, Bayu (ed.). "Jokowi Lantik Anies-Sandi, Sah Jakarta Punya Gubernur-Wagub Baru". Kompas (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 24 October - 7 Indonesians were killed after the bus they were riding on crashed in Penang. The Indonesian Government sent their condolences to the next of kin.

links.text: -Syarief, Ika Suryani (25 October 2017). "Tujuh WNI Tewas dalam Kecelakaan Bus di Malaysia". Suara Surabaya (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 26 October  the Tangerang fireworks disaster, the deadliest industrial accident in Indonesia, resulted in at least 47 people killed and 46 others injured in the incident.

links.text: -"Fireworks factory explosion kills at least 47 outside Jakarta". ABC News. 26 October 2017. Retrieved 28 October 2017.-
-Virtue, Rob (26 October 2017). "Jakarta explosion: Fireworks factory tragedy leaves 47 dead and many more injured". Express.co.uk. Retrieved 28 October 2017.-

Data.event_text: 28 October - The Indonesian Government stated that they didn't recognize the final results of the 2017 Catalonia independence referendum, in which it claimed that 90% of Catalans supported an independent Catalonia, and added that they would only recognize Catalonia as a part of Spain.

links.text: -Batu, Safrin La (29 October 2017). "Indonesia does not recognize 'unilateral' Catalan independence declaration". The Jakarta Post. Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 29 October - 4 girders collapsed on top of construction workers in Pasuruan. 1 worker was killed and 2 others were injured. An investigation was launched into the cause of the collapse.

links.text: -Prasetiyo, Wisnu (29 October 2017). Subagja, Indra (ed.). "Girder Proyek Tol Pasuruan-Probolinggo Ambruk, 1 Tewas dan 2 Luka". kumparan (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 31 October -1 November  - 88 earthquakes ranging from 5.0 to 6.0 struck Ambon, the capital of Maluku. Several structures were damaged. The Indonesian Agency for Meteorology, Climatology and Geophysics asked the residents of Ambon for calm in response to the earthquakes.

links.text: -Putri, Gloria Setyvani (1 November 2017). Utomo, Yunanto Wiji (ed.). "14 Jam, 88 Kali Gempa, Apa yang Sebenarnya Terjadi di Ambon? Halaman all". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: Suspected ISIS sympathizer set the Dharmasraya Police Headquarters in Dharmasraya, West Sumatra, on fire. Police officials stated that no police officers were injured in the incident. The incident was treated as a terror attack.

links.text: -Rahma, Andita (14 November 2017). Agustina, Widiarsi (ed.). "Pembakar Polres Dharmasraya Diduga Simpatisan ISIS". Tempo. Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: A massive 7.3 magnitude earthquake struck the province of Kermanshah in Iran. The quake was strongly felt in the Iraqi Kurdistan and throughout the Kermanshah province. At least 630 people were killed in the earthquake and thousands more were injured. The Indonesian Foreign Ministry announced that there were no Indonesians who were killed or injured in the disaster.

14 November - Puteri Indonesia Lingkungan 2017, Kevin Lilliana was crowned Miss International 2017 in the coronation night held at Tokyo Dome City Hall in Tokyo, Japan. She was the first ever Indonesian to win Miss International beauty pageant, the third oldest and biggest Big Four international beauty pageants in the world. During the speech portion of the pageant, the women were given a chance to express their plans if crowned Miss International and share their personal advocacies. Lilliana's speech read

1 December - The Indonesian Government sent a strong condemnation to the government of America after President Donald Trump announced that his administration officially recognized Jerusalem as the capital of Israel.

links.text: -Varagur, Krithika (7 December 2017). "Indonesia Slams American Jerusalem Plan". VOA. Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 5 December - Ministry of Health officially declared the diphtheria outbreak as Extraordinary Event (Kejadian Luar Biasa).

links.text: -Dinillah, Mukhlis (5 December 2017). "Berstatus KLB, Dinkes Jabar Investigasi Penyebaran Wabah Difteri". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-

Data.event_text: 18 December - Rallies to support Palestine were conducted across Indonesia.

links.text: -Utama, Abraham (18 December 2017). "Aksi bela Palestina, antara solidaritas kemanusiaan dan politik identitas". BBC News Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved 25 May 2023.-
